intro: Floscopa gossweileri, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has strap-like, evergreen leaves that are narrow and grass-like in appearance. Floscopa gossweileri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
